SIX MONTHS AGO

The train lurches violently. Metal screams against metal.
You're thrown against the wall as the carriages behind you derail, one after another, like dominoes falling in slow motion.

Forty-seven people dead. Including Sophie.

You were the lead engineer. You signed off on the maintenance reports.

But you didn't cut corners. You didn't ignore the failing brake systems.

Francois Marchand did.

But who's going to believe you over a wealthy industrialist?
